Air_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of air temperature in degrees Celsius.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Land_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of land surface temperature in degrees Celsius.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Rainfall_Scale_Factor.description: The scale factor used in multiplying rainfall value(s).

Relative_Humidity_Scale_Factor.description: The scale factor used in multiplying relative humidity values.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Base_Air_Temperature.description: The air temperature, in degrees Celsius, where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Land_Temperature.description: The land temperature, in degrees Celsius, where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Rainfall.description: The value of rainfall per day in millimeters when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Relative_Humidity.description: The value of humidity where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Air_Temperature_Filename.description: The path to the input data file defining air temperature data measured 2 meters above ground.

Climate_Model.description: How and from what files the climate of a simulation is configured.

Climate_Update_Resolution.description: The resolution for data in climate files.

Koppen_Filename.description: Path to input file used to specify Koppen climate classifications.

Land_Temperature_Filename.description: Path of input file defining temperature data measured at land surface.

Rainfall_Filename.description: Path of input file defining rainfall data.

Relative_Humidity_Filename.description: Path of input file defining relative humidity data measured 2 meters above ground.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Custom_Coordinator_Events.description: The list of valid, user-defined events for Event Coordinators that will be included in the campaign. Any event used in the campaign must either be one of the built-in events or in this list.

Custom_Individual_Events.description: The list of valid, user-defined events that will be included in the campaign. Any event used in the campaign must either be one of the built-in events or in this list.

Custom_Node_Events.description: The list of valid, user-defined events for nodes that will be included in the campaign. Any event used in the campaign must either be one of the built-in events or in this list.

Config_Name.description: The optional, user-supplied title naming a configuration.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation. For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Controls whether or not built-in demographics for default geography will be used. Note that the built-in demographics feature does not represent a real geographical location and is mostly used for testing.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration.  Note: VARIABLE_RATE_MIGRATION and LEVY FLIGHTS are currently not supported.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input EMOD starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by airplane.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: The likelihood that an individual who flies to another node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Enable_Aging.description: Controls whether or not individuals in a population age during the simulation.

Enable_Immunity.description: Controls whether or not an individual has protective immunity after an infection clears.

Enable_Skipping.description: Controls whether or not the simulation uses an optimization that can increase performance by up to 50% in some cases by probabilistically exposing individuals rather than exposing every single person. Useful in low-prevalence, high-population scenarios

Enable_Superinfection.description: Controls whether or not an individual can have multiple infections simultaneously.

Family_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The number of days to complete the trip and return to the original node.

Infection_Updates_Per_Timestep.description: Number of infection updates executed during each timestep. A timestep defaults to one day.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by foot travel.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who walks into a neighboring node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Max_Individual_Infections.description: Limit on the number of infections that an individual can have simultaneously.

Migration_Pattern.description: The type of migration pattern used for the trip. For example, a single roundtrip or several waypoints before retracing their steps to return home.

Minimum_Adult_Age_Years.description: The age, in years, after which an individual is considered an adult.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by road network.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by vehicle to another node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Roundtrip_Waypoints.description: The maximum number of points reached during a trip before steps are retraced on the return trip home.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by ship.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by ship into a neighboring node will return to the node of origin during the next migration. Used only when Enable_Sea_Migration is set to 1.

Base_Infectivity.description: The base infectiousness of individuals before accounting for transmission-blocking effects of acquired immunity and/or campaign interventions.  It has a slightly different meaning for each of the disease types.

Base_Mortality.description: The base mortality of the infection before accounting for individual immune modification factors. Depending on the setting of Mortality_Time_Course, this is either the daily probability of the disease being fatal (DAILY_MORTALITY) or the probability of death at the end of the infection duration (MORTALITY_AFTER_INFECTIOUS).

Enable_Disease_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to disease deaths.

Incubation_Period_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Incubation_Period_Distribution.description: The distribution type to use for assigning the incubation period to each individual in the population.

Incubation_Period_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Incubation_Period_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Incubation_Period_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Incubation_Period_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Incubation_Period_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Incubation_Period_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Incubation_Period_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Incubation_Period_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Incubation_Period_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Incubation_Period_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Incubation_Period_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Incubation_Period_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Incubation_Period_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Incubation_Period_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Incubation_Period_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Infectious_Period_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Infectious_Period_Distribution.description: The distribution type to use for assigning the infectious period to each individual in the population.

Infectious_Period_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Infectious_Period_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Infectious_Period_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Infectious_Period_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Infectious_Period_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Infectious_Period_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Infectious_Period_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Infectious_Period_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Infectious_Period_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Infectious_Period_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Infectious_Period_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Infectious_Period_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Infectious_Period_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Infectious_Period_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Infectious_Period_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Mortality_Time_Course.description: The method used to calculate disease deaths: on every time step or once at the end of the disease duration.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Symptomatic_Infectious_Offset.description: Amount of time, in days, after the infectious period starts that symptoms appear.

Config_Name.description: The optional, user-supplied title naming a configuration.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation. For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Proportion of regular egg hatching that still occurs when habitat dries up.

Egg_Arrhenius1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Egg_Arrhenius2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Egg_Hatch_Delay_Distribution.description: The distribution of the delay from oviposition to egg hatching.

Egg_Hatch_Density_Dependence.description: The effect of larval density on egg hatching rate.

Egg_Saturation_At_Oviposition.description: If laying all eggs from ovipositing females would overflow the larval habitat capacity on a given day, the means by which the viable eggs become saturated.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Controls whether or not built-in demographics for default geography will be used. Note that the built-in demographics feature does not represent a real geographical location and is mostly used for testing.

Enable_Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Controls whether or not eggs hatch at delayed rates, set by Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay, when the habitat dries up completely.

Enable_Egg_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not to include a daily mortality rate on the egg population, which is independent of climatic factors.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Egg_Hatchin.description: Controls whether or not temperature has an effect on egg hatching, defined by Egg_Arrhenius1 and Egg_Arrhenius2.

Enable_Vector_Aging.description: Controls whether or not vectors undergo senescence as they age.

Enable_Vector_Species_Report.description: A value of one will cause the VectorSpeciesReport.json file to be created.

Human_Feeding_Mortality.description: The fraction of mosquitoes, for all species, that die while feeding on a human.

Larval_Density_Dependence.description: The functional form of mortality and growth delay for mosquito larvae based on population density.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Offset.description: An offset factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Scalar.description: A scale factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

Larval_Rainfall_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on daily rainfall in millimeters, above which larval mortality is applied.

Mean_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: The mean delay in egg hatch time, in days, from the time of oviposition.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration.  Note: VARIABLE_RATE_MIGRATION and LEVY FLIGHTS are currently not supported.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Habitats set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Habitats parameter value of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input EMOD starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Temporary_Habitat_Decay_Factor.description: Factor to convert raw evaporation rate (ignoring boundary layer effects) to the daily rate of larval habitat loss for temporary habitats (Habitats set to TEMPORARY_RAINFALL). Units are (larval carrying capacity per day) / (kg per square meter per second).

Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality.description: Type of vector larval mortality function due to rainfall.

Wolbachia_Infection_Modification.description: The change in vector susceptibility to infection due to a Wolbachia infection.

Wolbachia_Mortality_Modification.description: The change in vector mortality due to a Wolbachia infection.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scale factor for the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Inverse_Width.description: Inverse width of sigmoidal sporozoite killing function of CSP antibody concentration.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Threshold.description: Threshold value on CSP antibody concentration for sporozoite killing.

Base_Sporozoite_Survival_Fraction.description: Fraction of sporozoites that survive to infect a hepatocyte in the absence of anti-CSP protection.

Mean_Sporozoites_Per_Bite.description: Mean number of sporozoites per infectious mosquito bite.

Report_Gametocyte_Smear_Sensitivity.description: For reports only.  The number of microliters of blood tested to find single gametocytes in a traditional smear (corresponds to inverse gametocytes/microliters sensitivity).

Report_Parasite_Smear_Sensitivity.description: For reports only.  The number of microliters of blood tested to find single parasites in a traditional smear (corresponds to inverse parasites/microliters sensitivity).

Antibody_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: The scale factor multiplied by antibody level to produce the rate of clearance of the infected red blood cell (IRBC) population.

Antigen_Switch_Rate.description: The antigenic switching rate per infected red blood cell per asexual cycle.

Base_Gametocyte_Fraction_Male.description: Fraction of gametocytes that are male.

Gametocyte_Stage_Survival_Rate.description: The rate of gametocyte survival from one development stage to the next in the absence of drugs or inflammatory immune response.

MSP1_Merozoite_Kill_Fraction.description: Fraction of merozoites inhibited from invading new erythrocytes when MSP1-specific antibody level is 1.

Malaria_Strain_Model.description: The generator that is used to construct the antigenic repertoire of a malaria infection.

Merozoites_Per_Hepatocyte.description: Number of IRBCs caused by a single infected hepatocyte at the start of infection.

Merozoites_Per_Schizont.description: Number of merozoites released by a single infected schizont after each asexual cycle. The number of resulting IRBC's depends on the RBC availability and merozoite-specific immunity.

Nonspecific_Antigenicity_Factor.description: Nonspecific antigenicity factor that adjusts antibody IRBC kill rate to account for IRBCs caused by antibody responses to antigenically weak surface proteins.

Number_Of_Asexual_Cycles_Without_Gametoc.description: Number of asexual reproduction cycles that do not produce gametocytes. All later cycles will produce gametocytes according to Base_Gametocyte_Production_Rate.

Parasite_Switch_Type.description: Parasite switch type for erythrocyte surface antigens.

RBC_Destruction_Multiplier.description: Number of total RBCs destroyed per infected rupturing schizont.

Antibody_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: The scale factor multiplied by antibody level to produce the rate of clearance of the infected red blood cell (IRBC) population.

Antigen_Switch_Rate.description: The antigenic switching rate per infected red blood cell per asexual cycle.

Base_Gametocyte_Fraction_Male.description: Fraction of gametocytes that are male.

Gametocyte_Stage_Survival_Rate.description: The rate of gametocyte survival from one development stage to the next in the absence of drugs or inflammatory immune response.

MSP1_Merozoite_Kill_Fraction.description: Fraction of merozoites inhibited from invading new erythrocytes when MSP1-specific antibody level is 1.

Merozoites_Per_Hepatocyte.description: Number of IRBCs caused by a single infected hepatocyte at the start of infection.

Merozoites_Per_Schizont.description: Number of merozoites released by a single infected schizont after each asexual cycle. The number of resulting IRBC's depends on the RBC availability and merozoite-specific immunity.

Nonspecific_Antigenicity_Factor.description: Nonspecific antigenicity factor that adjusts antibody IRBC kill rate to account for IRBCs caused by antibody responses to antigenically weak surface proteins.

Number_Of_Asexual_Cycles_Without_Gametoc.description: Number of asexual reproduction cycles that do not produce gametocytes. All later cycles will produce gametocytes according to Base_Gametocyte_Production_Rate.

Parasite_Switch_Type.description: Parasite switch type for erythrocyte surface antigens.

RBC_Destruction_Multiplier.description: Number of total RBCs destroyed per infected rupturing schizont.

Anemia_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Anemia_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value for hemoglobin count in grams per deciliter (g/dL) at which 50% of individuals die per day.

Anemia_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Anemia_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for anemia. Threshold units are in grams per deciliter (g/dL).

Antibody_CSP_Decay_Days.description: Exponential decay time for CSP antibody concentration (in days).

Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.description: The maximum daily rate of specific antibody capacity increase.

Antibody_Memory_Level.description: The limiting level of antibody capacity that remains after a prolonged absence of a specific antigen. The antibody capacity decays to this level gradually after infection is cleared.

Antibody_Stimulation_C50.description: The concentration of an antigen, measured in IRBC/ul at which growth in antibody capacity against the antigen increases at half the maximum rate specified by Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.

Base_Gametocyte_Mosquito_Survival_Rate.description: Average fraction of gametocytes in a blood meal that are successful in infecting the mosquito in the absence of other modulating effects, such as fever.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_High.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to start a clinical incident.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_Low.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to end a clinical incident.

Cytokine_Gametocyte_Inactivation.description: The strength of inflammatory response inactivation of :term:`gametocytes`.

Enable_Maternal_Antibodies_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not mothers pass antibodies to their infants.

Erythropoiesis_Anemia_Effect.description: The exponential rate of increased red-blood-cell production from reduced red-blood-cell availability.

Fever_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: The maximum kill rate for infected red blood cells due to the inflammatory innate immune response. As fever increases above 38.5 degrees Celsius, the kill rate becomes successively higher along a sigmoidal curve approaching this rate.

Fever_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for fever.

Fever_Mortality_Threshold.description: The fever mortality threshold, in units of degrees Celsius above normal body temperature (defined as 37 C); sets the midpoint in the sigmoidal response for mortality rate associated with fever.

Fever_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for fever.

Fever_Severe_Threshold.description: The threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) for fever indicating severe disease.

Innate_Immune_Variation_Type.description: The type of innate immunity on which to apply individual-level variation.

Maternal_Antibody_Decay_Rate.description: Decay rate per day in protection from maternal antibodies.

Maternal_Antibody_Protection.description: Strength of protection from maternal antibodies as a multiple of full antibody killing effect.

Max_MSP1_Antibody_Growthrate.description: Maximum increase in MSP1 antibody capacity during each asexual cycle. The higher this value, the sooner early clearances are observed and the earlier the parasite density envelope decreases.

Min_Adapted_Response.description: Minimum level of antibody stimulation to novel antigen. The value sets the low-range asymptote for antibody capacity growth, which is calculated from Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate and antigen density, in the presence of any nonzero antigen level.

Min_Days_Between_Clinical_Incidents.description: The number of days with fever below the low threshold before a new incident can start when the high fever threshold is again exceeded.

Nonspecific_Antibody_Growth_Rate_Factor.description: Factor that adjusts Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate for less immunogenic surface proteins called the minor epitopes.

Parasite_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Parasite_Mortality_Threshold.description: The parasite-density mortality threshold for a simulation.

Parasite_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Parasite_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for parasite density.

PfHRP2_Boost_Rate.description: The rate at which PfHRP2 protein is being added to the blood stream by the infected red blood cells. - pg/iRBC/day: 1.4e-13 grams per 48h / 2 (48h cycle to daily)

PfHRP2_Decay_Rate.description: The fraction of the protein decaying each day (based on 3.67 day half-life)

Pyrogenic_Threshold.description: Level of bloodstream infection, measured in IRBC per microliter, at which stimulation of the innate inflammatory immune response is half its maximum value.

Memory_Usage_Halting_Threshold_Working_S.description: The maximum size of working set memory before the system throws an exception and halts.

Memory_Usage_Warning_Threshold_Working_S.description: The maximum size of working set memory before memory usage statistics are written to the log regardless of log level.

x_Local_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Filename.description: The path to the input data file defining patterns of migration by airplane.

Enable_Air_Migration.description: Controls whether or not migration by air travel will occur.

Enable_Family_Migration.description: Controls whether or not all members of a household can migrate together when an MigrateFamily event occurs. All residents must be home before they can leave on the trip.

Enable_Local_Migration.description: Controls whether or not local migration (the diffusion of people in and out of nearby nodes by foot travel) occurs.

Enable_Migration_Heterogeneity.description: Controls whether or not migration rate is heterogeneous among individuals.

Enable_Regional_Migration.description: Controls whether or not there is migration by road or rail network into and out of nodes in the simulation.

Enable_Sea_Migration.description: Controls whether or not there is migration on ships into and out of coastal cities with seaports.

Family_Migration_Filename.description: The name of the binary file to use to configure family migration.

Local_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration to adjacent nodes by foot travel.

Regional_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by vehicle via road or rail network. If the node is not on a road or rail network, regional migration focuses on the closest hub city in the network.

Sea_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by ship.

x_Air_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by air.

x_Family_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by families.

x_Local_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

x_Regional_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by road vehicle.

x_Sea_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by sea.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: The method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: The base rate of sampling for individuals, equal to the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season ends.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season begins

Birth_Rate_Dependence.description: The method used to modify the value set in BirthRate in the demographics file.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: The amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: The phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: A scale factor for BirthRate that allows it to be altered by time or season.

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: Determines how likely individuals are to die from natural, non-disease causes.

Enable_Birth.description: Controls whether or not individuals will be added to the simulation by birth.

Enable_Demographics_Birth.description: Controls whether or not newborns have identical or heterogeneous characteristics.

Enable_Demographics_Risk.description: Controls whether or not the simulation includes the impact of disease risk in demographics.

Enable_Infectivity_Reservoir.description: Controls whether or not an exogenous reservoir of infectivity will be included in the simulation and allows for the infectivity in a node to be increased additively.

Enable_Initial_Prevalence.description: Controls whether or not parameters in the demographics file are used to define a distribution for the number of infected people per node at the beginning of the simulation. Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not infectious mothers infect infants at birth.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Controls whether or not susceptibility is scaled by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Controls whether or not births and deaths occur in the simulation.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: The threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity-dependent downsampling; individuals who are more immune than this threshold are downsampled.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: The type of individual human sampling to use, which can be used to down sample large populations, certain age groups, or the immune population that does not contribute to transmission.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Exponential_Baseline.description: The scale factor applied to Base_Infectivity at the beginning of a simulation, before the infectivity begins to grow exponentially.

Infectivity_Exponential_Delay.description: The number of days before infectivity begins to ramp up exponentially.

Infectivity_Exponential_Rate.description: The daily rate of exponential growth to approach full infectivity after the delay set by Infectivity_Exponential_Delay has passed.

Infectivity_Scale_Type.description: Alter infectivity by time or season.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probabil.description: Probability of transmission of infection from mother to infant at birth. Note: For malaria and vector simulations, set this to 0.

Max_Node_Population_Samples.description: The maximum number of individuals to track in a node. When the population exceeds this number, the sampling rate will drop according to the value set in Individual_Sampling_Type.

Population_Density_C50.description: The population density at which R0 for a 2.5-arc minute square reaches half of its initial value.

Population_Density_Infectivity_Correctio.description: Correction to alter infectivity by population density set in the Population_Density_C50 parameter. Measured in people per sq. km. Note: Sparsely populated areas have a lower infectivity, while densely populated areas have a higher infectivity, which rises to saturate at the Base_Infectivity value.

Population_Scale_Type.description: The method to use for scaling the initial population specified in the demographics input file.

Relative_Sample_Rate_Immune.description: Relative sampling rate for people who have acquired immunity through recovery or vaccination. If set to 1, this will have no effect, even if the individual's immunity modifier is below threshold.

Sample_Rate_0_18mo.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for infants age 0 to 18 months.

Sample_Rate_10_14.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 10 to 14 years.

Sample_Rate_15_19.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for adolescents age 15 to 19 years.

Sample_Rate_18mo_4yr.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 18 months to 4 years.

Sample_Rate_20_Plus.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for adults age 20 and older.

Sample_Rate_5_9.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 5 to 9 years.

Sample_Rate_Birth.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for births.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Rate.description: The scaling rate for the variation in time of the log-linear susceptibility scaling.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.description: The effect of time on susceptibility.

x_Base_Population.description: Scale factor for InitialPopulation in the demographics file.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Scale factor for mortality from causes other than the disease being simulated.

Demographics_Filenames.description: An array of the paths to demographics files containing information on the identity and demographics of the region to simulate.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: The method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: The base rate of sampling for individuals, equal to the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season ends.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season begins

Birth_Rate_Dependence.description: The method used to modify the value set in BirthRate in the demographics file.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: The amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: The phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: A scale factor for BirthRate that allows it to be altered by time or season.

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: Determines how likely individuals are to die from natural, non-disease causes.

Enable_Birth.description: Controls whether or not individuals will be added to the simulation by birth.

Enable_Demographics_Birth.description: Controls whether or not newborns have identical or heterogeneous characteristics.

Enable_Demographics_Risk.description: Controls whether or not the simulation includes the impact of disease risk in demographics.

Enable_Infectivity_Reservoir.description: Controls whether or not an exogenous reservoir of infectivity will be included in the simulation and allows for the infectivity in a node to be increased additively.

Enable_Initial_Prevalence.description: Controls whether or not parameters in the demographics file are used to define a distribution for the number of infected people per node at the beginning of the simulation. Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not infectious mothers infect infants at birth.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Controls whether or not susceptibility is scaled by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Enable_Vector_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not vectors can die.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Controls whether or not births and deaths occur in the simulation.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: The threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity-dependent downsampling; individuals who are more immune than this threshold are downsampled.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: The type of individual human sampling to use, which can be used to down sample large populations, certain age groups, or the immune population that does not contribute to transmission.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.
