x_Base_Population.description: Scale factor for InitialPopulation in the demographics file.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Scale factor for mortality from causes other than the disease being simulated.

Random_Number_Generator_Policy.description: The policy that determines if random numbers are generated for objects in a simulation on a per-core or per-node basis.

Random_Number_Generator_Type.description: The type of random number generator to use for objects in a simulation. Must set the RNG seed in Run_Number.

Run_Number.description: Sets the random number seed used with Random_Number_Generator_Type and Random_Number_Generator_Policy to assign random numbers to objects in a simulation.

Inset_Chart_Has_IP.description: A channel is added to InsetChart for each value of each IP provided.  The channel name will be HasIP_<Key:Value> and will be the fraction of the population that has that value for that IPKey.

Inset_Chart_Has_Interventions.description: A channel is added to InsetChart for each InterventionName provided.  The channel name will be Has_<InterventionName> and will be the fraction of the population that has that intervention.  The 'Intervention_Name' in the campaign should be the values in this parameter.

Inset_Chart_Include_Pregnancies.description: If true, channels are added about pregnancies and possible mothers.

Report_Event_Recorder_End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List is set.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If set to 0, only the events listed in the Report_Event_Recorder_Events array will be included in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to 1, only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: Specifies an array of (optional) individual property keys, as defined in **IndividualProperties** in the demographics file, to be added as additional columns to the output report.

Report_Event_Recorder_Max_Age_Years.description: Maximum age in years of people to collect data on

Report_Event_Recorder_Min_Age_Years.description: Minimum age in years of people to collect data on

Report_Event_Recorder_Must_Have_IP_Key_V.description: A Key:Value pair that the individual must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include IPs in the selection criteria.

Report_Event_Recorder_Must_Have_Interven.description: The name of the intervention that the person must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include interventions in the selection criteria.

Report_Event_Recorder_Node_IDs_Of_Intere.description: Data will be collected for the nodes in this list.  Empty list implies all nodes.

Report_Event_Recorder_PropertyChange_IP_.description: If the string is not empty, then the recorder will add the PropertyChange event to the list of events that the report is listening to. However, it will only record the events where the property changed the value of the given key.

Report_Event_Recorder_Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how **Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List** is set.

Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder_Ignore.description: If set to false (0), only the events listed in the **Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder_Events** array will be included in the ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to true (1), only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of node events to include or exclude in the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how **Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List** is set.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events.description: If set to false (0), only the node events listed in the **Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Events** array will be included in the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to true (1), only the node events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other node events will be included. If you want to return all node events from the simulation, leave the node events array empty.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Node_Properti.description: Specifies an array of (optional) node property keys, as defined in **NodeProperties** in the demographics file, to be added as additional columns to the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder_Stats_By_IPs.description: Specifies an array of (optional) individual property keys, as defined in **IndividualProperties** in the demographics file, to be added to the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report. An empty array equals no additional columns added.

Inset_Chart_Has_IP.description: A channel is added to InsetChart for each value of each IP provided.  The channel name will be HasIP_<Key:Value> and will be the fraction of the population that has that value for that IPKey.

Inset_Chart_Has_Interventions.description: A channel is added to InsetChart for each InterventionName provided.  The channel name will be Has_<InterventionName> and will be the fraction of the population that has that intervention.  The 'Intervention_Name' in the campaign should be the values in this parameter.

Inset_Chart_Include_Pregnancies.description: If true, channels are added about pregnancies and possible mothers.

Inset_Chart_Reporting_Include_30Day_Avg_.description: If true the '30-Day Avg Infection Duration' channel is included in the InsetChart.json report.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder_Event.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how **Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List** is set.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder_Ignor.description: If set to false (0), only the events listed in the **Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder_Events** array will be included in the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to true (1), only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder_Stats.description: Specifies an array of (optional) individual property keys, as defined in **IndividualProperties** in the demographics file, to be added to the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report.

Enable_Random_Generator_From_Serialized_.description: Determines if the random number generator(s) should be extracted from a serialized population file. Enabling this will start a simulation from this file with the exact same random number stream and location in that stream as when the file was serialized.

Serialization_Mask_Node_Read.description: A control that determines what data is read from the serialized file. If the control is set, the configuration file is used. For example, a value of 0 implies that the Larval Habitat data is read from the serialized file while a value of 16 implies that the habitats are configured using the data from the configuration file (i.e. config.json).

Serialization_Mask_Node_Write.description: A control that determines what data is written to the serialized file letting the user reduce the file size.  If the mask is set, the data of the masked module is not written to the file. For example, a value of 0 implies that the Larval Habitat data is written to the serialized file while a value of 16 implies that the habitats are not saved.

Serialization_Precision.description: Default is REDUCED to reduce the size of the serialized file.  FULL gives more floating point precision but creates larger files.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: The list of time steps after which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step. The serialized population files can then be loaded at the beginning of a simulation using Serialized_Population_Filenames and Serialized_Population_Path.

Serialization_Times.description: The list of times at which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates the time to serialize in terms of start time and step size, and will be rounded up to the nearest time step. The serialized population files can then be loaded at the beginning of a simulation using Serialized_Population_Filenames and Serialized_Population_Path

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: An array of filenames with serialized population data. The number of filenames must match the number of cores used for the simulation.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for the serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Reading_Type.description: Set to READ to enable reading from a serialized population file, set to NONE otherwise.

Serialized_Population_Writing_Type.description: The type of serialization to perform. NONE for no serialization, TIME to use definition from Serialization_Times, and TIMESTEP to use definition from Serialization_Time_Steps.

Campaign_Filename.description: The path to the campaign file.

Custom_Reports_Filename.description: The name of the file containing custom report configuration parameters. Omitting this parameter or setting it to RunAllCustomReports will load all reporters found that are valid for the given simulation type.

Enable_Default_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not the default InsetChart.json report is created.

Enable_Demographics_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not demographic summary data and age-binned reports are outputted to file.

Enable_Property_Output.description: Controls whether or not property output reports are created.

Enable_Spatial_Output.description: Controls whether or not spatial output reports are created.

Enable_Termination_On_Zero_Total_Infecti.description: Controls whether or not the simulation should be ended when total infectivity falls to zero. Supported only in single-node simulations.

Load_Balance_Filename.description: Path to input file used when a static load balancing scheme is selected.

Minimum_End_Time.description: The minimum time step the simulation must reach before checking for early termination conditions.

Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv output report for coordinator events.

Report_Event_Recorder.description: Set to true (1) to enable or to false (0) to disable the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report that lists individual events in the simulation.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Campaign_Filename.description: The path to the campaign file.

Custom_Reports_Filename.description: The name of the file containing custom report configuration parameters. Omitting this parameter or setting it to RunAllCustomReports will load all reporters found that are valid for the given simulation type.

Enable_Default_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not the default InsetChart.json report is created.

Enable_Demographics_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not demographic summary data and age-binned reports are outputted to file.

Enable_Property_Output.description: Controls whether or not property output reports are created.

Enable_Spatial_Output.description: Controls whether or not spatial output reports are created.

Enable_Termination_On_Zero_Total_Infecti.description: Controls whether or not the simulation should be ended when total infectivity falls to zero. Supported only in single-node simulations.

Falciparum_MSP_Variants.description: The number of distinct MSP variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation, not necessarily in an individual.

Falciparum_Nonspecific_Types.description: The number of distinct non-specific types of P. falciparum malaria.

Falciparum_PfEMP1_Variants.description: The number of distinct PfEMP1 variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation.

Insecticides.description: An Array of insecticides and their resistance modifiers

Load_Balance_Filename.description: Path to input file used when a static load balancing scheme is selected.

Malaria_Drug_Params.description: This JSON structure contains the names of anti-malarial drugs and the parameters that define them.

Malaria_Model.description: The type of malaria model used in a simulation.

Minimum_End_Time.description: The minimum time step the simulation must reach before checking for early termination conditions.

Parasite_Genetics.description: The set of parameters needed for modeling the genetics of plasmodium falciparum.

Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv output report for coordinator events.

Report_Detection_Threshold_Blood_Smear_G.description: gametocytes/microliter-For each person in the sim, the BLOOD_SMEAR_GAMETOCYTES diagnostic must have more gametocytes than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Detection_Threshold_Blood_Smear_P.description: parsites/microliter-For each person in the sim, the BLOOD_SMEAR_PARASITES diagnostic must have more parasites than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Detection_Threshold_Fever.description: Level of body temperature above normal, in degrees Celsius, corresponding to detectable fever.  Normal body temperature is defined as 37 degrees Celsius.

Report_Detection_Threshold_PCR_Gametocyt.description: gametocytes/microliter-For each person in the sim, the PCR_GAMETOCYTES diagnostic must have more gametocytes than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Detection_Threshold_PCR_Parasites.description: parasites/microliter-For each person in the sim, the PCR_PARASITES diagnostic must have more parasites than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Detection_Threshold_PfHRP2.description: picograms/microliter-For each person in the sim, the PF_HRP2 diagnostic must have more PfHRP2 protein than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Detection_Threshold_True_Parasite.description: parasites/microliter-For each person in the sim, the TRUE_PARASITE_DENSITY diagnostic must have more parasites than this threshold to be counted as detected.  This impacts all reports keeping track of this stat for the population.

Report_Event_Recorder.description: Set to true (1) to enable or to false (0) to disable the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report that lists individual events in the simulation.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Vector_Species_Params.description: A list of JSON object where each object contains the parameters for a specific species of vectors.

Campaign_Filename.description: The path to the campaign file.

Custom_Reports_Filename.description: The name of the file containing custom report configuration parameters. Omitting this parameter or setting it to RunAllCustomReports will load all reporters found that are valid for the given simulation type.

Enable_Default_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not the default InsetChart.json report is created.

Enable_Demographics_Reporting.description: Controls whether or not demographic summary data and age-binned reports are outputted to file.

Enable_Property_Output.description: Controls whether or not property output reports are created.

Enable_Spatial_Output.description: Controls whether or not spatial output reports are created.

Enable_Termination_On_Zero_Total_Infecti.description: Controls whether or not the simulation should be ended when total infectivity falls to zero. Supported only in single-node simulations.

Insecticides.description: An Array of insecticides and their resistance modifiers

Load_Balance_Filename.description: Path to input file used when a static load balancing scheme is selected.

Minimum_End_Time.description: The minimum time step the simulation must reach before checking for early termination conditions.

Report_Coordinator_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv output report for coordinator events.

Report_Event_Recorder.description: Set to true (1) to enable or to false (0) to disable the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report that lists individual events in the simulation.

Report_Node_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportNodeEventRecorder.csv output report.

Report_Surveillance_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv output report.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Vector_Species_Params.description: A list of JSON object where each object contains the parameters for a specific species of vectors.

Spatial_Output_Channels.description: An array of channel names for spatial output by node and time step. The data from each channel will be written to a separate binary file. For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

An array of channel names for spatial output by node and time step. The data from each channel will be written to a separate binary file. For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

An array of channel names for spatial output by node and time step. The data from each channel will be written to a separate binary file. For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: The rate at which acquisition-blocking immunity decays after the initial period indicated by the base acquisition-blocking immunity offset.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_B.description: The number of days after infection until acquisition-blocking immunity begins to decay.

Enable_Immune_Decay.description: Controls whether or not immunity decays after an infection clears.

Enable_Initial_Susceptibility_Distributi.description: Controls whether or not individuals in the population have immunity at the beginning of the simulation. If set to 0, individuals are not initialized with immunity but may acquire immunity. If set to 1, you must indicate the type of distribution to use for immunity in the configuration parameter Susceptibility_Initialization_Distribution_Type and the distribution values in the demographics file.

Enable_Maternal_Protection.description: Controls whether or not mothers pass immunity on to their infants. Setting to 1 (true) enables maternal protection as defined by Maternal_Protection_Type.

Maternal_Linear_Slope.description: Slope parameter describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. The per-day increase in susceptibility.

Maternal_Linear_SusZero.description: The initial level of maternal protection at age 0, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

Maternal_Protection_Type.description: The type of maternal protection afforded to infants.

Maternal_Sigmoid_HalfMaxAge.description: The age in days that the level of maternal protection is half of its initial value.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SteepFac.description: The steepness factor describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. Small values imply rapid waning.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SusInit.description: The initial level of maternal protection at age -INF, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: Rate at which mortality-blocking immunity decays after the mortality-blocking immunity offset period.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_Bef.description: Number of days after infection until mortality-blocking immunity begins to decay.

Post_Infection_Acquisition_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of reacquiring the disease.

Post_Infection_Mortality_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of dying from infection after getting re-infected.

Post_Infection_Transmission_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of transmitting infection after getting re-infected.

Susceptibility_Initialization_Distributi.description: The method for initializing the susceptibility distribution in the simulated population.

Susceptibility_Type.description: Controls implementation of an individual's susceptibility.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rat.description: Rate at which transmission-blocking immunity decays after the base transmission-blocking immunity offset period. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_.description: Number of days after infection until transmission-blocking immunity begins to decay. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Config_Name.description: The optional, user-supplied title naming a configuration.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation. For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Proportion of regular egg hatching that still occurs when habitat dries up.

Egg_Arrhenius1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Egg_Arrhenius2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Egg_Hatch_Delay_Distribution.description: The distribution of the delay from oviposition to egg hatching.

Egg_Hatch_Density_Dependence.description: The effect of larval density on egg hatching rate.

Egg_Saturation_At_Oviposition.description: If laying all eggs from ovipositing females would overflow the larval habitat capacity on a given day, the means by which the viable eggs become saturated.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Controls whether or not built-in demographics for default geography will be used. Note that the built-in demographics feature does not represent a real geographical location and is mostly used for testing.

Enable_Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Controls whether or not eggs hatch at delayed rates, set by Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay, when the habitat dries up completely.

Enable_Egg_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not to include a daily mortality rate on the egg population, which is independent of climatic factors.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Egg_Hatchin.description: Controls whether or not temperature has an effect on egg hatching, defined by Egg_Arrhenius1 and Egg_Arrhenius2.

Enable_Vector_Aging.description: Controls whether or not vectors undergo senescence as they age.

Enable_Vector_Species_Report.description: A value of one will cause the VectorSpeciesReport.json file to be created.

Human_Feeding_Mortality.description: The fraction of mosquitoes, for all species, that die while feeding on a human.

Larval_Density_Dependence.description: The functional form of mortality and growth delay for mosquito larvae based on population density.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Offset.description: An offset factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Scalar.description: A scale factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

Larval_Rainfall_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on daily rainfall in millimeters, above which larval mortality is applied.

Mean_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: The mean delay in egg hatch time, in days, from the time of oviposition.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration.  Note: VARIABLE_RATE_MIGRATION and LEVY FLIGHTS are currently not supported.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Habitats set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Habitats parameter value of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input EMOD starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Temporary_Habitat_Decay_Factor.description: Factor to convert raw evaporation rate (ignoring boundary layer effects) to the daily rate of larval habitat loss for temporary habitats (Habitats set to TEMPORARY_RAINFALL). Units are (larval carrying capacity per day) / (kg per square meter per second).

Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality.description: Type of vector larval mortality function due to rainfall.

Wolbachia_Infection_Modification.description: The change in vector susceptibility to infection due to a Wolbachia infection.

Wolbachia_Mortality_Modification.description: The change in vector mortality due to a Wolbachia infection.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scale factor for the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Age_Dependent_Biting_Risk_Type.description: The type of functional form for age-dependent biting risk.

Newborn_Biting_Risk_Multiplier.description: Scale factor that defines the y-intercept of the linear portion of the biting risk curve when Age_Dependent_Biting_Risk_Type is set to LINEAR.

Event_Coordinator_Config.description: An object that specifies how the event is handled by the simulation. It specifies which Event Coordinator class will handle the event, and then configures the coordinator. This description starts with specifying class, and then the other fields depend on the class.

Nodeset_Config.description: An object that specifies in which nodes the interventions will be distributed. Set to one of the :ref:`campaign-nodeset-config`.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to activate the event's event coordinator. Depending on the event coordinator and intervention, this may indicate when to distribute an intervention or when to begin listening for a trigger.

Broadcast_Event.description: The name of the Coordinator Event to be broadcast. This event must be set in the **Custom_Coordinator_Events** configuration parameter. This cannot be assigned an empty string for the event.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per each of these event coordinators created.

Distribution_Coverages.description: A vector of floats for the fraction of individuals that will receive this intervention in a **CalendarEventCoordinator**.

Distribution_Times.description: A vector of integers for simulation times at which distribution of events occurs in a CalendarEventCoordinator.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Amount_In_Shipment.description: The number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that a health worker or clinic receives in a shipment. Interventions can only be distributed if they are in stock; stock is updated every **Days_Between_Shipments** with the **Amount_In_Shipment**.

Days_Between_Shipments.description: The number of days to wait before a clinic or health worker receives a new shipment of interventions (such as vaccine doses). Interventions can only be distributed if they are in stock; stock is updated every **Days_Between_Shipments** with the **Amount_In_Shipment**.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Duration.description: The number of days for an event coordinator to be active before it expires.

Initial_Amount_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Initial_Amount_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the initial amount of interventions in stock. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Initial_Amount_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Initial_Amount_Max** and **Initial_Amount_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Initial_Amount_Gaussian_Mean** and **Initial_Amount_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Initial_Amount_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Initial_Amount_Kappa** and **Initial_Amount_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Initial_Amount_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Initial_Amount_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Initial_Amount_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Initial_Amount_Proportion_0** and **Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Initial_Amount_Mean_1**, **Initial_Amount_Mean_2**, and **Initial_Amount_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Initial_Amount_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Initial_Amount_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Initial_Amount_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Initial_Amount_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Initial_Amount_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Initial_Amount_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Initial_Amount_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Initial_Amount_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Initial_Amount_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Initial_Amount_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Initial_Amount_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Initial_Amount_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Initial_Amount_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Initial_Amount_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Initial_Amount_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Max_Distributed_Per_Day.description: The maximum number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that can be distributed by health workers or clinics in a given day.

Max_Stock.description: The maximum number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that can be stored by a health worker or clinic. If the amount of interventions in a new shipment and current stock exceeds this value, only the number of interventions specified by this value will be stored.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of individual events that are of interest to the community health worker (CHW). If one of these events occurs, the individual or node is put into a queue to receive the CHW's intervention. The CHW processes the queue when the event coordinator is updated.

Waiting_Period.description: The number of days a person or node can be in the queue waiting to get the intervention from the community health worker (CHW). If a person or node is in the queue, they will not be re-added to the queue if the event that would add them to the queue occurs. This allows them to maintain their priority, however they could be removed from the queue due to this waiting period.

Coverage_By_Node.description: An array of (nodeID, coverage) pairs configuring the demographic coverage of interventions by node for the targeted populations. The coverage value must be a float between 0 and 1.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Number_Repetitions.description: The number of times an intervention is given, used with **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions**. A value of -1 implies an infinite number of repetitions.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

The target demographic group. Possible values are:

* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male

* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Timesteps_Between_Repetitions.description: The number of time steps -  not days - between repetitions.  If the **Simulation_Timestep** is set to 30 days and **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions** is set to 4, then there will be 120 days between repetitions.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Delay_Complete_Event.description: A coordinator event that is broadcasted when the delay period is completed.  One can use **ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder** to collect data on these events.

Delay_Period_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Delay_Period_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the delay period for distributing interventions. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set. 
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Delay_Period_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Delay_Period_Max** and **Delay_Period_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Delay_Period_Gaussian_Mean** and **Delay_Period_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Delay_Period_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Delay_Period_Kappa** and **Delay_Period_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Delay_Period_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Delay_Period_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Delay_Period_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Delay_Period_Proportion_0** and **Delay_Period_Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Delay_Period_Mean_1**, **Delay_Period_Mean_2**, and **Delay_Period_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Delay_Period_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Delay_Period_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Delay_Period_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Delay_Period_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Delay_Period_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Delay_Period_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Delay_Period_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Delay_Period_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Delay_Period_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Delay_Period_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Delay_Period_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Delay_Period_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Delay_Period_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Delay_Period_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Delay_Period_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Duration.description: The number of days from when the event coordinator was created by the campaign event. Once the number of days has passed, the event coordinator will unregister for events and expire. A value of -1 (the defalt) keeps the intervention running indefinitely.

Start_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will start a new delay. If the delay event coordinator has already been triggered and is currently waiting for the duration of a delay, it will then ignore a new delay event. The list cannot be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Stop_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will stop the delay period, but does not stop the event coordinator. The **Delay_Complete_Event** will not be broadcasted.  If the coordinator receives another start event, it will draw a new delay period and restart the countdown. The coordinator does not expire until the **Duration** has expired. The list can be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Node_ID_To_Coordinator_Event_List.description: The list of Node ID & Coordinator Event pairs to find the first node id that has the given **NodeProperty**.

Node_Property_Key_Value_To_Have.description: The **NodeProperty** key:value pair that the node must have to get its event broadcasted.

Not_Found_Coordinator_Event.description: Coordinator event to broadcast when a node with the given **NodeProperty** key:value pair is not found. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Start_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coodinator events that when one is heard will start an attempt to send an event based on the selection of a node. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Incidence_Counter.description: List of JSON objects for specifying the conditions and parameters that must be met for an incidence to be counted.

Number_Repetitions.description: The number of times an intervention is given, used with **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions**. A value of -1 implies an infinite number of repetitions.

Responder.description: A JSON object for specifying the actions to take when the specified conditions and parameters have been met, as configured in the **Incidence_Counter** parameter.

Timesteps_Between_Repetitions.description: The number of time steps -  not days - between repetitions.  If the **Simulation_Timestep** is set to 30 days and **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions** is set to 4, then there will be 120 days between repetitions.

Distributions.description: The ordered list of elements defining when, to whom, and how many interventions to distribute.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Individual_Selection_Type.description:
Defines how the people that pass all of the other target restrictions are selected. Possible values are:
* DEMOCGRAPHIC_COVERAGE - When set, the parameter **Demographic_Coverage** is used to randomly select a certain percentage of the targeted group.
* TARGET_NUM_INDIVIDUALS - When set, the parameter **Target_Num_Individuals** is used to select exactly that number of people out of the targeted group.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Number_Repetitions.description: The number of times an intervention is given, used with **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions**. A value of -1 implies an infinite number of repetitions.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Num_Individuals.description: The exact number of people to select out of the targeted group. **Individual_Selection_Type** must be set to TARGET_NUM_INDIVIDUALS.

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Timesteps_Between_Repetitions.description: The number of time steps -  not days - between repetitions.  If the **Simulation_Timestep** is set to 30 days and **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions** is set to 4, then there will be 120 days between repetitions.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Duration.description: The number of days from when the event coordinator was created by the campaign event. Once the number of days has passed, the event coordinator will unregister for events and expire. A value of -1 (the defalt) keeps the intervention running indefinitely.

Incidence_Counter.description: List of JSON objects for specifying the conditions and parameters that must be met for an incidence to be counted.

Responder.description: A JSON object for specifying the actions to take when the specified conditions and parameters have been met, as configured in the **Incidence_Counter** parameter.

Start_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will start the **Incidence_Counter** counting events. The surveillance event coordinator will keep counting and responding until it gets a stop event, as defined in **Stop_Trigger_Condition_List**, or the duration of the surveillance event coordinator has expired, as defined in **Duration**. The list cannot be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Stop_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will stop the **Incidence_Counter** from counting events. The coordinator can start counting again if it receives a new start trigger event. The coordinator does not expire until the **Duration** has expired. The list can be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Completion_Event.description: The completion event list that will be broadcast every time the triggered event coordinator completes a set of repetitions. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Duration.description: The number of days from when the event coordinator was created by the campaign event. Once the number of days has passed, the event coordinator will unregister for events and expire. It will expire whether or not it is in the middle of a set of repetitions. A value of -1 (default) keeps the intervention running indefinitely.

Individual_Selection_Type.description:
Defines how the people that pass all of the other target restrictions are selected. Possible values are:
* DEMOCGRAPHIC_COVERAGE - When set, the parameter **Demographic_Coverage** is used to randomly select a certain percentage of the targeted group.
* TARGET_NUM_INDIVIDUALS - When set, the parameter **Target_Num_Individuals** is used to select exactly that number of people out of the targeted group.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Number_Repetitions.description: The number of times an intervention is given, used with **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions**. A value of -1 implies an infinite number of repetitions.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Start_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will start a new set of repetitions for the triggered event coordinator. The list cannot be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Stop_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will stop any repetitions for the triggered event coordinator until a new start event in the list is received. The coordinator does not expire until the **Duration** has expired. The list can be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Num_Individuals.description: The exact number of people to select out of the targeted group. **Individual_Selection_Type** must be set to TARGET_NUM_INDIVIDUALS.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Timesteps_Between_Repetitions.description: The number of time steps -  not days - between repetitions.  If the **Simulation_Timestep** is set to 30 days and **Timesteps_Between_Repetitions** is set to 4, then there will be 120 days between repetitions.

Coordinator_Name.description: The name of the event coordinator, which is useful in output reports such as ReportCoordinatorEventRecorder.csv and ReportSurveillanceEventRecorder.csv.  EMOD does not ensure that this name is unique.  It is up to the user.

Counter.description: Configuration dictionary of the sampling parameters.

Duration.description: The number of days from when the event coordinator was created by the campaign event. Once the number of days has passed, the event coordinator will unregister for events and expire. A value of -1 (the defalt) keeps the intervention running indefinitely.

Responder.description: A JSON object for specifying additional parameters on how the coordinator reacts to the counting of the vectors.  This is in addition to the coordinator broadcasting the coordinator events returned by the users python code.

Start_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will start the VectorSurveillanceEventCoordinator to run a sampling every Update_Period, starting at the time trigger is received. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Stop_Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of coordinator events that when one is heard will cause the **Counter** to stop sampling and will keep the **Responder** from responding. The coordinator does not expire until the **Duration** has expired. The list can be empty. The events contained in the list are defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Adherence_Config.description: Configuration for the probability of taking a dose of the specified anti-malarial. Use a waning effect class, :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`, to specify how this probability changes over time.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per intervention distributed. For interventions distributed to people, the cost will be added for each person. For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their individual property). See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Dose_Interval.description: The number of days to wait between the doses defined in the **Doses** parameter.

Doses.description: This is a two dimensional array of the drug names defined in the config. parameter **Malaria_Drug_Params**. Each inner array defines the drugs to be taken for a single dose. The number of doses is determined by the number of inner arrays. An empty dose is allowed and counts as if the person did not take any doses that day. If multiple pills of the same drug are taken in the same dose, that drug name can be specified multiple times.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Max_Dose_Consideration_Duration.description: The maximum number of days that an individual will consider taking the doses of the drug.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Non_Adherence_Distribution.description: The non adherence probability value(s) assigned to the corresponding options in **Non_Adherence_Options**. The sum of non adherence distribution values must equal a total of 1.

Non_Adherence_Options.description:
Defines the action the person takes if they do not take a particular dose, are not adherent. Possible values are:
* NEXT_UPDATE - The person does not take the dose during this update, but will consider taking during the next update (and may not take the dose then). If this person is infected, the time to the next update depends on **Infection_Updates_Per_Timestep**.
* OST_TAKE_NEXT - The person lost the dose and so takes the next dose in the pill pack (so the total number of pills is reduced).
* NEXT_DOSAGE_TIME - The person missed a dose and waits until the next dosage time to take the pill, in order to remain on the prescribed dosage schedule.
* STOP - The person decides to stop taking the pills (or has lost the pill pack). Pills taken prior to STOP will have an effect, no remaining pills will be taken.

Took_Dose_Event.description: This event is broadcast each time a person takes a dose from the pill pack.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per intervention distributed. For interventions distributed to people, the cost will be added for each person. For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Drug_Type.description: The type of drug to distribute in a drugs intervention. This must be a value defined in the configuration parameter **Malaria_Drug_Params**.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Risk_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Risk_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the relative risk of being bitten by a mosquito to each individual. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Risk_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Risk_Max** and **Risk_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Risk_Gaussian_Mean** and **Risk_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Risk_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Risk_Kappa** and **Risk_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and width. Set **Risk_Log_Normal_Mean** and **Risk_Log_Normal_Width**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Risk_Poisson_Mean**.
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Risk_Proportion_0** and **Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Risk_Mean_1**, **Risk_Mean_2**, and **Risk_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Risk_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Risk_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Risk_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Risk_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Risk_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Risk_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Risk_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Risk_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Risk_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Risk_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Risk_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Risk_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Risk_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Risk_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Risk_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Broadcast_Event.description: The name of the event to be broadcasted. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values, or create custom values using **Custom_Individual_Events**.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.
