For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Insecticides.description: An array of insecticide definitions where the user can specify the killing WaningEffect of each insecticide.

Spray_Coverage.description: The proportion of the node that has been sprayed.  This value is multiplied by the current efficacy of the **WaningEffect**.

Node_Intervention_List.description: A list of nested JSON objects for the multi-node-level interventions to be distributed by this intervention.

Actual_NodeIntervention_Config.description: The configuration of the actual node-level intervention sought. This parameter selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class.

Blackout_Event_Trigger.description: The node event to broadcast if an intervention cannot be distributed due to the **Blackout_Period**.  See **config.Custom_Node_Events**.

Blackout_On_First_Occurrence.description: If set to true (1), individuals will enter the blackout period after the first occurrence of an event in the **Trigger_Condition_List**.

Blackout_Period.description: After the initial intervention distribution, the time, in days, to wait before distributing the intervention again. If it cannot distribute due to the blackout period, it will broadcast the user-defined **Blackout_Event_Trigger**.

You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of node events that tigger **NLHTIVNode** to distribute the intervention defined in **Actual_NodeIntervention_Config**. Custom events may be defined in **Custom_Node_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Config.description: The configuration of an actual individual intervention to be distributed on the trigger. Selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class.

Actual_NodeIntervention_Config.description: The configuration of the actual node-level intervention sought. This parameter selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of individual events that will trigger the distribution of the intervention. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or the custom events defined in **Custom_Individual_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Daily_Probability.description: The daily probability that the node's property value changes to the **Target_NP_Key_Value**.

Maximum_Duration.description: The maximum amount of time in days nodes have to update the property value. This timing works in conjunction with **Daily_Probability**.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **NodeProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information.

Revert.description: The number of days to keep the value of the property/key, specified in **Target_NP_Key_Value** and set by the intervenion, for the node. When the time has expired, the intervention will reset the property/key back to the value it had when the intervention was first applied.

Target_NP_Key_Value.description: The **NodeProperty** key:value pair, as defined in the demographics file, to assign to the node.

Antigen.description: The antigenic base strain ID of the outbreak infection.

Genome.description: The genetic substrain ID of the outbreak infection. Together with **Antigen**, they are a unitary object representing a strain of infection, which allows for differentiation among infections.

Import_Age.description: The age (in days) of infected import cases.

Number_Cases_Per_Node.description:
The number of new imported individuals.
.. note:: This will increase the population with demographics of 50/50 male/female and user-defined ages

Probability_Of_Infection.description: The probability that new individuals are infected. 1.0 implies all new individuals are infected while 0.0 adds all of the people as susceptible individuals.

The oviposition habitat type targeted by oviposition traps. This is a required parameter. NONE is the default to ensure the user selects it. If not ALL_HABITATS, then the type must be one of those configured in **Vector_Species_Params**, **Habitats**. See :doc:`parameter-configuration-larval` parameters for more information. Possible values are:

* NONE - Default but not allowed; it must be defined.
* TEMPORARY_RAINFALL
* WATER_VEGETATION
* HUMAN_POPULATION
* CONSTANT
* BRACKISH_SWAMP
* LINEAR_SPLINE
* ALL_HABITATS

If there is skip oviposition, this does not configure the mortality per skip, but instead configures the effective net mortality per gonotrophic cycle over all skips. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Expiration_Period_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Expiration_Period_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for setting the expiration of the intervention. Each intervention gets an expiration duration by doing a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set Expiration_Constant.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set Expiration_Max and Expiration_Min.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set Expiration_Gaussian_Mean and Expiration_Gaussian_Std_Dev.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set Expiration_Exponential.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set Expiration_Kappa and Expiration_Lambda.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set Expiration_Log_Normal_Mu and Expiration_Log_Normal_Sigma.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set Expiration_Poisson_Mean.
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION
    Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set Expiration_Proportion_0 and Expiration_Peak_2_Value. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set Expiration_Mean_1, Expiration_Mean_2, and Expiration_Proportion_1. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Expiration_Period_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Expiration_Period_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Expiration_Period_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Expiration_Period_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Expiration_Period_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Expiration_Period_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Expiration_Period_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Expiration_Period_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Expiration_Period_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Expiration_Period_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Expiration_Period_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Expiration_Period_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Polygon_Format.description: The type of polygon to create. Currently, SHAPE is the only supported value.

Vertices.description: Comma-separated list of latitude/longitude points that bound a polygon.

Event_To_Broadcast.description: The action event to occur when the specified trigger value in the **Threshold** parameter is met. At least one action must be defined for **Event_To_Broadcast**. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events).

Event_Type.description: The type of event to be broadcast.  Possible values are: COORDINATOR, INDIVIDUAL, or NODE

Threshold.description: The COUNT or PERCENTAGE, as configured with **Threshold_Type**, threshold value that must be met before the action from **Action_List** will be considered.  The sampled value must be greater than or equal to this value and less than the action whose threshold is greater in order for the action to be selected.  Once selected, it will broadcast the **Event_To_Broadcast** event.

IP_Key_Value.description: An **IndividualProperties** Key:Value pair where the key/property name and one of its values is separated by a colon (':').

Is_Equal_To.description: This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.

Intervention_Name.description: The name of the intervention the person should have.  This cannot be an empty string but should be either the name of the class or the name given to the intervention of interest using the parameter Intervention_Name.  EMOD does not verify that this name exists.

Is_Equal_To.description: This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.
This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.

Logic.description: This is a two-dimensional array of JSON objects.  The elements of the inner array will be AND'd together while the arrays themselves will be OR'd.  This is similar to **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**.  This array and the inner arrays cannot be empty.

Age.description: As a parameter of a Calendar object, this parameter determines the age (in days) that the individual must be in order to receive the list of actual interventions.

Probability.description: As a parameter of a Calendar object, this parameter determines the probability of an individual receiving the list of actual interventions at the corresponding age.

Max.description: This parameter determines the maximum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Min.description: This parameter determines the minimum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Allele_Combinations.description: The combination of alleles that a mosquito's genome must have in order to apply associated Probability.  You do not need to specify alleles for every locus.  The ones not defined are not considered in the match.  The default is zero.

Probability.description: The probability to use if the genome of the mosquito has the matching Allele_Combinations.

Allele_To_Copy.description: The main allele to be copied.

Allele_To_Replace.description: The allele that must exist and will be replaced by the copy.

Copy_To_Likelihood.description: This is a dictionary of allele-to-likelihood.  If the other gamete has the 'Allele_To_Replace', this is the likelihood that it will result in one of the specified values.  Notice that you can specify the 'Allele_To_Copy' to indicate the probability that the copy failed or other alleles to account for mutation in the copy process.

Copy_To_Allele.description: The name of the allele to be copied.  It must be an allele of the same gene as the 'Allele_To_Copy' and 'Allele_To_Replace'.

Likelihood.description: The likelihood that the copy process will produce this allele.  If you give the 'Allele_To_Replace', you are defining the likelihood the copy fails.  If you give the 'Allele_To_Copy', you are specifying the likelihood of success.  Definitions for other alleles define possible mutations.

Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose.description: The fraction of the adult drug dose given to children below the age defined in Upper_Age_In_Years.

Upper_Age_In_Years.description: The age, in years, below which children are given a fraction of the adult drug dose, as defined in Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose.

Drug_Resistant_String.description: A series of nucleotide base letters (A, C, G, T) that represent the drug resistant values at locations in the genome.  There must be one character for each location defined in <config>.Parasite_Genetics.Drug_Resistant_Genome_Locations.

Max_IRBC_Kill_Modifier.description: If the parasite has this drug resistant string, this value will be multiplied times the 'Max_Drug_IRBC_Kill' value of the drug.  Genomes with multiple matching strings will be simply multiplied together.

PKPD_C50_Modifier.description: If the parasite has this drug resistant string, this value will be multiplied times the 'Drug_PKPD_C50' value of the drug.  Genomes with multiple matching strings will be simply multiplied together.

Allele_Combinations.description: This defines a possible subset of allele pairs that a vector could have.  Each pair are alleles from one gene.  If the vector has this subset, then the associated traits will be adjusted.  Order does not matter.  '*' is allowed when only the occurrence of one allele is important.

Trait_Modifiers.description: This is an array of trait-modifier pairs.  Vectors with the associated allele combination will have this set of traits modified.

Default_Probability.description: The probability used if the genome of the mosquito does not match any of the defined allele combinations in Genetic_Probabilities.

Genetic_Probabilities.description: An array of dictionaries defining probabilities for a given species and allele combination.

Age_Bins.description: The age bins (in years, in ascending order) to aggregate within and report. An empty array does not stratify by age.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Barcodes.description: A list of barcode strings. The report contains the number of human infections with each barcode.  Use '*' for a wild card at a loci to include all values at that loci.  For example, 'A*T' includes AAT, ACT, AGT, and ATT. The report contains an OtherBarcodes column for barcodes that are not defined. Note: There is no validation that the barcode strings are valid barcodes for the scenario.

Drug_Resistant_And_HRP_Statistic_Type.description:
Indicates the statistic in the Drug Resistant & HRP columns. Possible values are:
* NUM_PEOPLE_WITH_RESISTANT_INFECTION - A person is counted if they have one infection with that drug resistant marker
* NUM_INFECTIONS - The total number of infections with that marker.

Drug_Resistant_Strings.description: A list of strings representing the set of drug resistant markers. A column will be created with the number of human infections with that Drug Resistant String. Use '*' for a wild card at a loci to include all values at that loci. A 'NoDrugResistance' column will be created for drug resistant strings not defined.

HRP_Strings.description: A list of strings representing the set of HRP markers. A column will be created with the number of human infections with that HRP String. Use '*' for a wild card at a loci to include all values at that loci. An 'OtherHRP' column will be created for HRP strings not defined.

Age_At_Infection_Histogram_Report_Age_Bi.description: A list of ages in years where an individual will count in the upper value bin when their age is between two bins.

Age_At_Infection_Histogram_Report_Report.description: This is the amount of time data is collected and then written to the file.  This value has units in years.

Max_Age_Years.description: Maximum age in years of people to collect data on

Min_Age_Years.description: Minimum age in years of people to collect data on

Must_Have_IP_Key_Value.description: A Key:Value pair that the individual must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include IPs in the selection criteria.

Must_Have_Intervention.description: The name of the intervention that the person must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include interventions in the selection criteria.

Node_IDs_Of_Interest.description: Data will be collected for the nodes in this list.  Empty list implies all nodes.

Reporting_Interval.description: The Number of days to collect data and average over.

Spatial_Output_Channels.description: An array of channel names for spatial output by node and time step. The data from each channel will be written to a separate binary file. For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Include_Health_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the Health table which has data for each time step for the health of an individual.

Include_Individual_Properties.description: Include a table with all the possible IPs and include the IP data for each person in the Health table.

Include_Infection_Data_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the InfectionData table which has data for each time step for each active infection.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Include_Drug_Status_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the table that provides data at each time step for each drug the person has.

Include_Health_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the Health table which has data for each time step for the health of an individual.

Include_Individual_Properties.description: Include a table with all the possible IPs and include the IP data for each person in the Health table.

Include_Infection_Data_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the InfectionData table which has data for each time step for each active infection.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Include_Drug_Status_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the table that provides data at each time step for each drug the person has.

Include_Health_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the Health table which has data for each time step for the health of an individual.

Include_Individual_Properties.description: Include a table with all the possible IPs and include the IP data for each person in the Health table.

Include_Infection_Data_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the InfectionData table which has data for each time step for each active infection.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

Count_Events_For_Num_Timesteps.description: If set to true (1), then the waning effect values, as specified in the Effect_List list of objects for the WaningEffectCombo classes, are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value cannot be greater than 1.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of individual events that when broadcasted by an individual will be counted by the **Incidence_Counter** if the individual is in the targeted group. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or the custom events defined in **Custom_Individual_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Count_Events_For_Num_Timesteps.description: If set to true (1), then the waning effect values, as specified in the Effect_List list of objects for the WaningEffectCombo classes, are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value cannot be greater than 1.

Counter_Event_Type.description:
Type of events that can be included in **Trigger_Condition_List**. Possible values are:
* COORDINATOR
* INDIVIDUAL
* NODE

Counter_Period.description: When **Counter_Type** is set to PERIODIC, this is the counter period (in days).

Counter_Type.description: Counter type used for surveillance of events. The counter is triggered by events in **Start_Trigger_Condition_List** and the counter stops when it receives an event in **Stop_Trigger_Condition_List** or the listening duration expires. The only current allowed value is PERIODIC - Once triggered, events are counted during the period (in days) as set in **Counter_Period**. At the end of the period, the counter will notify **Responder** with the data accumulated and then start listening again, continuing forever until it is stopped or the duration expires. For example, if the listening duration is 45 days, **Counter_Period** is 30, and the counter is triggered on day 20, it will never complete the counter period and trigger the responder.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: The list of events that when broadcasted will be counted by the **Incidence_Counter**. The list cannot be empty. The type of events contained in the list is determined by the **Counter_Event_Type** parameter. Depending upon the type, the events must be built-in (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or defined in one of the following configuration parameters: **Custom_Coordinator_Events**, **Custom_Individual_Events**, or **Custom_Node_Events**.

Resistances.description: An array of resistance modifier objects that define how to modify the efficacy of the insecticide for particular vector genomes.

Blocking_Config.description: Object in the **Insecticides** array, configures the rate of blocking for indoor mosquito feeds on individuals with an ITN - conditional on the mosquito NOT being repelled. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Insecticide_Name.description: The name of the insecticide defined in the configuration parameter **Insecticides** for this intervention.  If insecticides are being used,  this must be defined as one of those values; if they are not being used this can be empty.  It cannot have a value if you did not configure the configuration parameter **Insecticides**.

Killing_Config.description: The configuration of repelling efficacy and waning for the intervention with respect to the given insecticide. A vector is repelled before any blocking or killing can occur. It is an object in the **Insecticides** array. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Repelling_Config.description: The configuration of repelling efficacy of the intervention. A vector is repelled before any blocking or killing can occur. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Times.description: An array of days or years, depending on how it is used.  The **Times** and **Values** must be of equal length, and can consist of a single value. **Times** must monotonically increase.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.  The meaning of the value depends on how it is being used.  It could be coverage fraction, intervention efficacy, or even a probability.  It must have the same number of elements as its associated parameter **Times**

Factor.description: The multiplier by which to scale the larval habitat availability.

Habitat.description:
The name of the habitat for which to specify a larval habitat multiplier. See :doc:`parameter-configuration-larval` parameters for more information. Possible values are:
* NONE (default but not allowed; it must be configured to a habitat type)
* TEMPORARY_RAINFALL
* WATER_VEGETATION
* MARSHY_STREAM
* HUMAN_POPULATION
* CONSTANT
* BRACKISH_SWAMP
* LINEAR_SPLINE
* ALL_HABITATS

Species.description: The name of the species for which to specify a larval habitat multiplier. This must be one of the names specified in the configuration parameter **Vector_Species_Params** or set to ALL_SPECIES.

Bodyweight_Exponent.description: Effect of bodyweight on maximum drug concentration in an individual patient.

Drug_Cmax.description: The maximum drug concentration that can be used, and is in the same units as **Drug_PKPD_C50**. Since drug concentrations and C50 values are often specified with different unit systems, these two parameters have been designed to be flexible provided that the units are the same for each. This parameter is used when **Durability_Profile** is set to CONCENTRATION_VERSUS_TIME.

Drug_Decay_T1.description: The primary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Decay_T2.description: The secondary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Dose_Interval.description: The number of days to wait between does.

Drug_Fulltreatment_Doses.description: The number of doses for a full treatment.

Drug_Gametocyte02_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in early-stage :term:`gametocytes`.

Drug_Gametocyte34_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in late-stage :term:`gametocytes`.

Drug_GametocyteM_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in mature gametocytes at saturated drug concentration.

Drug_Hepatocyte_Killrate.description: The log reduction in hepatocytes per day.

Drug_PKPD_C50.description: The concentration at which drug killing rates are half of the maximum. Must use the same units as **Drug_Cmax**. This parameter is used when **Durability_Profile** is set to CONCENTRATION_VERSUS_TIME.

Drug_Vd.description: The volume of drug distribution in a pharmacokinetic two compartment model. This value is the ratio of the volume of the second compartment to that of the first.

Fractional_Dose_By_Upper_Age.description: An array to specify the fraction of the adult dose to use for children at various ages. Contain Upper_Age_In_Years and Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose values.

Max_Drug_IRBC_Kill.description: Maximum log reduction in IRBCs per day due to treatment.

Name.description: The unique name of the drug.

PKPD_Model.description: The pharmacokinetic pharmacodynamic model to use.

Duration_To_Disease_Acquisition_Modifica.description: A modifier is selected based on the duration of the age of the microsporidia infection.  The modifier is used to modify the probability the vector acquires the disease (i.e. malaria).

Duration_To_Disease_Transmission_Modific.description: A modifier is selected based on the duration of the age of the microsporidia infection.  The modifier is used to modify the probability the vector transmit the disease (i.e. malaria).

Female_Mortality_Modifier.description: A modifier on the death rate for female vectors due to general life expectancy, age, and dry heat

Female_To_Egg_Transmission_Probability.description: The probability an infected female will infect her eggs when laying them.

Female_To_Male_Transmission_Probability.description: The probability an infected female will infect an uninfected male during mating.

Larval_Growth_Modifier.description: A modifier to the daily, temperature dependent, larval growth progression to immature.

Male_Mortality_Modifier.description: A modifier on the death rate for male vectors due to general life expectancy, age, and dry heat

Male_To_Egg_Transmission_Probability.description: The probability a female that mated with an infected male will infect her eggs when laying them, independent of her being infected and transmitting to her offspring.

Male_To_Female_Transmission_Probability.description: The probability an infected male will infect an uninfected female during mating.

Strain_Name.description: The name/identifier of the collection of transmission parameters. Cannot be empty string.

Coverage.description: The percentage of people in the node that should be randomly selected to receive the intervention.  The value must be a float between 0 and 1.

Node_Id.description: The ID of the node specified in the demographics to which this coverage applies.

Coordinator_Event_To_Broadcast.description: The coordinator event to broadcast when the node is selected (i.e. is the first one found with the NP key:value).

Node_ID.description: The ID of the node found in the demographics to check if it has the given node property.

<key>.description: Node Property Key from demographics file.

<value>.description: Node Property Value from demographics file.

Barcode_Genome_Locations.description: This is an array of genome locations where each barcode allele is found.  Its length determines how many values are in the barcode.  That is, if you want a 24-SNP barcode, then there should be 24 locations. This can be initialized to be empty if there are no Barcode positions to be tracked.

Crossover_Gamma_K.description: The 'K' or shape parameter of the gamma distribution used to select the secondary crossover points.  Remember the mean is K*Theta and variance is K*Theta*Theta.  Output of the distribution is assumed to be in centimorgans which is internally converted to genome locations/base pairs.

Crossover_Gamma_Theta.description: The 'Theta' or scale parameter of the gamma distribution used to select the secondary crossover points.  Remember the mean is K*Theta and variance is K*Theta*Theta.  Output of the distribution is assumed to be in centimorgans which is internally converted to genome locations/base pairs.

Drug_Resistant_Genome_Locations.description: This is an array of genome locations where each drug resistant allele is found.  Its length determines the total number of possible drug related markers.  These locations and possible values can be used in Malaria_Drug_Params.Resistances to indicate when the effect of a drug should be modified.

Enable_FPG_Similarity_To_Base.description: If true the Full Parasite Genetics model will simulate the base model.  That is, a person can only get one infection per timestep, only adult vectors can get infected, and a vectors is always infected once it becomes infected.

HRP_Genome_Locations.description: This is an array of genome locations where each HRP allele is found.  Its length determines the total number of possible HRP related markers.  A value of 'A' implies that the HRP marker is not present.  A non-'A' value implies that HRP is present.

MSP_Genome_Location.description: This is a single genome location representing where the merozoite surface protein (MSP) gene is found in the genome.  The initial value of the MSP will be set randomly by the model, but we define its location in the genome here. This cannot be empty as it is required for the immune model.

Neighborhood_Size_MSP.description: The number of MSP variants to randomly select the MSP variant.  This is an 'neighborhood' around a number based on the barcode.

Neighborhood_Size_PfEMP1.description: The number of PfEMP1 variants to randomly select for the i'th PfEMP1 variant.  This is an 'neighborhood' around a number based on the barcode.

Num_Oocyst_From_Bite_Fail.description: Used to determine the number of oocyst to generate in the mosquito from an infectious bite-number of failures.  The genome of the oocyst depend on the gametocytes in the bite.

Num_Sporozoites_In_Bite_Fail.description: Used in a negative binomial to the number of sporozoites delivered to the human in a bite from a mosquito-number of failures

PfEMP1_Variants_Genome_Locations.description: This is an array of genome locations representing where the major epitopes, PfEMP1 variants, are found in the genome.  The initial values will be set randomly by the model, but we define the locations here.  There must be 50 locations defined. This cannot be empty as it is required for the immune model.

Probability_Oocyst_From_Bite_Fails.description: Used to determine the number of oocyst to generate in the mosquito from an infectious bite-probability of failure.

Probability_Sporozoite_In_Bite_Fails.description: BD-Used in a negative binomial to the number of sporozoites delivered to the human in a bite from a mosquito-probability of failure

Sporozoite_Life_Expectancy.description: The number of days sporozoite survives in the mosquito.  The mortality rate will be the inverse of this parameter.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Distribution.description: Determines the number of sporozoites to create for each oocyst.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Sporozoites_Per_Oocyst_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Var_Gene_Randomness_Type.description: This controls how random the var genes are in each new infection.  FIXED_NEIGHBORHOOD implies that the are set when the genome is created and each infection with this genome gets the same set of var genes.  FIXED_MSP implies that the MSP var gene is fixed but the PfEMP1 Major var genes are random for every infection.  ALL_RANDOM implies that the MPS and PfEMP1 Major var genes are random with every infection.  The minor epitopes are always random.

<key>.description: Individual Property Key from demographics file.

<value>.description: Individual Property Value from demographics file.

Allele_Combination.description: An array of array of strings that defines a genome.  Each value is an allele.  '*' is allowed to imply all.

Allele_Combinations.description: The combination of alleles that vectors must have in order to be resistant.  These alleles must be defined in <config.Vector_Species_Params.Genes.Alleles> for the associated species.

Blocking_Modifier.description: The value used to modify (multiply) the blocking effectivity of an intervention

Killing_Modifier.description: The value used to modify (multiply) the killing effectivity of an intervention

Larval_Killing_Modifier.description: The value used to modify (multiply) the larval killing effectivity of an intervention

Repelling_Modifier.description: The value used to modify (multiply) the repelling effectivity of an intervention

Species.description: Name of the species of vectors.  Must be defined in <config.Vector_Species_Params>

Action_List.description: An array specifying a list of possible actions (JSON objects with parameters **Threshold**, **Event_Type**, **Event_To_Broadcast**) to take if a particular threshold is met. An action is taken when the specified threshold value is less than the number of incidents counted. If there are multiple actions listed, then the action with the highest threshold value, that is also less than the number of incidents counted, is selected. The list cannot be empty.

Threshold_Type.description:
The threshold type indicates how **Responder** handles the counting of events from **Incidence_Counter** and the thresholds in **Action_List**. Possible values are:
* COUNT - A raw count of events. Also, with COUNT, setting the **x_Base_Population** configuration parameter can affect the number count by changing the population but it could be very indirect.
* PERCENTAGE - Counts the number of individuals that meet the restrictions and then to divide the total number of events by this number. Note that it is possible for an individual to emit an event that might not be counted in the denominator if their demographic restriction attributes changed between the time of the emitted event and the time the denominator was counted.
PERCENTAGE_EVENTS (supported in **SurveillanceEventCoordinator** only) - **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator, which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** to be counted for the numerator.

Action_List.description: An array specifying a list of possible actions (JSON objects with parameters **Threshold**, **Event_Type**, **Event_To_Broadcast**) to take if a particular threshold is met. An action is taken when the specified threshold value is less than the number of incidents counted. If there are multiple actions listed, then the action with the highest threshold value, that is also less than the number of incidents counted, is selected. The list cannot be empty.

Percentage_Events_To_Count.description: When **Threshold_Type** equals PERCENTAGE_EVENTS then **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** counted for the numerator.

Responded_Event.description: A coordinator event, defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events**, that is broadcast if **Responder** responded. More specifically, at the completion of a counting period, if an action is selected, the action events are broadcast and then the **Responded_Event** is also broadcast.  This allows other event coordinators to react to the action events being broadcast.

Threshold_Type.description:
The threshold type indicates how **Responder** handles the counting of events from **Incidence_Counter** and the thresholds in **Action_List**. Possible values are:
* COUNT - A raw count of events. Also, with COUNT, setting the **x_Base_Population** configuration parameter can affect the number count by changing the population but it could be very indirect.
* PERCENTAGE - Counts the number of individuals that meet the restrictions and then to divide the total number of events by this number. Note that it is possible for an individual to emit an event that might not be counted in the denominator if their demographic restriction attributes changed between the time of the emitted event and the time the denominator was counted.
PERCENTAGE_EVENTS (supported in **SurveillanceEventCoordinator** only) - **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator, which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** to be counted for the numerator.

Allele_Required.description: The genome must have this gender allele in order for shredding to occur. If the driver is X_SHRED, then the allele must be designated as a Y chromosome. If the driver is Y_SHRED, then the allele must NOT be designated as a Y chromosome.

Allele_Shredding_Fraction.description: This is the fraction of the Alleles_To_Shred that will be converted to Allele_To_Shred_To.  If this value is less than one, then some of the Allele_To_Shred will remain and be part of the gametes.

Allele_To_Shred.description: The genome must have this gender allele in order for shredding to occur. If the driver is X_SHRED, then the allele must NOT be designated as a Y chromosome. If the driver is Y_SHRED, then the allele must be designated as a Y chromosome.

Allele_To_Shred_To.description: This is a gender allele that the 'shredding' will change the Allele_To_Shred into. It can be a temporary allele that never exists in the output or could be something that appears due to resistance/failures.

Allele_To_Shred_To_Surviving_Fraction.description: A trait modifier will automatically generated for [ Allele_To_Shred_To, * ], the trait ADJUST_FERTILE_EGGS, and this value as its modifier. A value of 0 implies perfect shredding such that no Allele_To_Shred_To survive in the eggs. A value of 1 means all of the 'shredded' alleles survive.

Age_Ranges_Years.description: A list of age ranges that individuals must be in to qualify for an intervention. Each age range is a JSON object with a minimum and a maximum property. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age. It must have the same number of objects as **Num_Targeted_XXX** has elements.

End_Day.description: The day to stop distributing the intervention. No interventions are distributed on this day or going forward. Defines the time period to distribute the intervention along with **Start_Day**. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Num_Targeted.description: The number of individuals to target with the intervention. Note that this value will be scaled up by the population scaling factor equal to **Base_Population_Scale_Factor**. If using this parameter, **Num_Targeted_Males** and **Num_Targeted_Females** must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Females.description: The number of female individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using this parameter with **Num_Targeted_Males** to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and **Num_Targeted** must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Males.description: The number of male individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using this parameter with **Num_Targeted_Females** to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and **Num_Targeted** must be empty.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Start_Day.description: The day to start distributing the intervention. Defines the time period to distribute the intervention along with **End_Day**. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Gametocyte_A_Barcode_String.description: If the trait modifier is 'OOCYST_PROGRESSION', then you must define this parameter with a valid parasite barcode.  If the mosquito satisfies the vector genetics and has at least one gametocyte that has the 'A' barcode and the 'B' barcode, then the modifier will be applied to the progression of the oocysts with the barcodes in the satisfying mosquito.

Gametocyte_B_Barcode_String.description: If the trait modifier is 'OOCYST_PROGRESSION', then you must define this parameter with a valid parasite barcode.  If the mosquito satisfies the vector genetics and has at least one gametocyte that has the 'A' barcode and the 'B' barcode, then the modifier will be applied to the progression of the oocysts with the barcodes in the satisfying mosquito.

Modifier.description: The multiplier to use to modify the given trait for vectors with the given allele combination.

Sporozoite_Barcode_String.description: If the trait modifier is 'SPOROZOITE_MORTALITY', then you must define this parameter with a valid parasite barcode.  If the mosquito satisfies the vector genetics and has at least one sporozoite with this barcode, the modifier will be applied to the mortality of the mosquito's sporozoites with that barcode.

Trait.description: The trait to be modified of vectors with the given allele combination.

Initial_Allele_Frequency.description: This is frequency of the allele at this locus in the population at initialization.

Is_Y_Chromosome.description: True implies that this allele represents the Y chromosome.  This can only be used when 'Is_Gender_Allele' is also true.

Name.description: The name of an allele at this locus.  It must be unique for a given species of vector.

Mutate_From.description: If the allele in the gamete that could mutate.

Mutate_To.description: The allele that this locus will change to during gamete generation.

Probability_Of_Mutation.description: The probability that the allele will mutate from one allele to the other during the creation of the gametes.

Count_Type.description: The attribute to count in the mosquitoes being sampled. The statistic returned by the Vector_Counter will be with respect to how this attribute relates to the mosquitos sampled. Possible values are 'ALLELE_FREQ' - Calculates the frequency of every allele in the sampled population. NOTE: This will be account the occurrences of the allele where there can be two per vector(i.e.you can get 0, 1, or 2 from each vector); GENOME_FRACTION - Calculates the fraction of each (grouped by similar) genome in the sampled population.

Gender.description: The sex of the vectors we are sampling. Options are VECTOR_MALE, VECTOR_FEMALE, VECTOR_BOTH_GENDERS.

Sample_Size_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Sample_Size_Distribution.description: The distribution dictionary to use for determining the number of vectors in the sample for each sampling. If the population is less than this number, then the entire population will be selected.

Sample_Size_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Sample_Size_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Sample_Size_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Sample_Size_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Sample_Size_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Sample_Size_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Sample_Size_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Sample_Size_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Sample_Size_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Sample_Size_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Sample_Size_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Sample_Size_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Sample_Size_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Sample_Size_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Sample_Size_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Species.description: The name of the species to sample the mosquitoes from. This string must be defined by the Name parameter in the config.Vector_Species_Param parameters.

Update_Period.description: The number of days between the sampling of the mosquito population. If the mosquitoes are sampled on day 1 and the period is 30, then the next sample will be taken on day 31.

Alleles.description: This is an array of allele name-initial allele frequency pairs.  The initial frequencies of the alleles must add to one.  All possible allele of a gene must be defined here.  Allele names must be unique across all genes.  A gene can have a max of 8 alleles.

Is_Gender_Gene.description: True implies that the alleles of this gene are for gender.  If defining the gender gene, X & Y must be defined.  One can have 4 alleles of a particular gender type.

Mutations.description: (Germline Mutation) This is an array of elements that define allele mutations that occur during the creation of the gametes. An allele cannot mutate into itself.

Alleles_Driven.description: If the drive can be activated, then these elements define the probabilities of how alleles are copied.

Driver_Type.description: This indicates the type of driver.  CLASSIC-The driver can only drive if the one gamete has the driving allele and the other has a specific allele to be replaced; INTEGRAL_AUTONOMOUS-At least one of the gametes must have the driver.  Alleles can still be driven if the driving allele is in both gametes or even if the driving allele cannot replace the allele in the other gamete.  X_SHRED can be used to reduce the number of female eggs produced while Y_SHRED does the opposite and reduced the number of male eggs produced.  DAISY_CHAIN can be used for drives that do not drive themselves but can be driven by another allele.

Driving_Allele.description: This is the allele that is known as the driver.

Driving_Allele_Params.description: If the drive is X_SHRED or Y_SHRED and it can be activated, then these parameters define how the driver is copied.

Shredding_Alleles.description: If the drive is X_SHRED or Y_SHRED and it can be activated, then these parameters define how gender alleles are shredded.

Capacity_Distribution_Number_Of_Years.description: The total length of time in years for the scaling.  If the simulation goes longer than this time, the pattern will repeat.  Ideally, this value times 365 is the last value in 'Capacity_Distribution_Over_Time'.

Capacity_Distribution_Over_Time.description: This allows one to scale the larval capacity over time.  The Times and Values arrays must be the same length where Times is in days and Values are a scale factor per degrees squared.  The value is multiplied times the max capacity and 'Node_Grid_Size' squared/4. Ideally, you want the last value  to equal the first value if they are one day apart.  A point will be added if not.

Habitat_Type.description: The type of habitat that this species of vectors use for eggs.  Each species can have at most one of each type.  You cannot use ALL_HABITATS.

Survey_Completed_Event.description: Optional Coordinator-level event that will be sent out every time VectorSurveillanceEventCoordinator surveys the vector population.

Acquire_Modifier.description: Modifier of the probability of successful infection of a mosquito by an infected individual, given the individual's infectiousness.

Adult_Life_Expectancy.description: Number of days an average female mosquito survives. The daily female mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Anthropophily.description: Propensity of the mosquito to feed on humans instead of animals, measured as a fraction of blood meals from human hosts.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for development rate as vectors progress from egg-hatching to emergence.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for development rate as vectors progress from egg-hatching to emergence.

Aquatic_Mortality_Rate.description: The base aquatic mortality per day for the species before adjusting for effects of overpopulation and drying out of aquatic habitat.

Blood_Meal_Mortality.description: The genetic probability that a mosquito will die after a blood meal.  This can be a fitness cost to some genetically modified mosquitoes.  The default is zero.

Cycle_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for feeding cycle rate.

Cycle_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for feeding cycle rate.

Cycle_Arrhenius_Reduction_Factor.description: The scale factor applied to cycle duration (from oviposition to oviposition) to reduce the duration when primary follicles are at stage II rather than I in the case of newly emerged females.

Days_Between_Feeds.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the daily rate, 1 / (value of this parameter), at which female mosquitoes attempt to feed.  The Days_Between_Feeds parameter represents a 3-day feeding cycle at normal tropical temperatures (30 C) 4 days at 24 C, and an increase in the fraction of 2-day cycles from 30 C to 48 C.

Drivers.description: This is an array of Driver elements.  They change the likelihood that other alleles will be propagated from one parent's gamete to the other parent's gamete when the cells merge.

Egg_Batch_Size.description: Size of egg batch laid by one female mosquito that has fed successfully.

Gene_To_Trait_Modifiers.description: This object defines that if a vector has a particular set of allele pairs, then some of their traits will be modified.  In most cases, this will consist of a single pair of allele associated with impact of one trait.  We provide support for the many-to-many case for when things aren't simple.

Genes.description: This is an array of Gene elements.  Each element defines all the possible allele for the gene and possible allele mutations.  Every vector will have two of the alleles of every gene.  There will be a max of 10 genes.  By default, one of the 10 genes is the gender 'gene' that has two alleles - X and Y.  This allows the user to use the X & Y alleles in Gene_To_Trait_Modifiers.

Habitats.description: A measure of the habitat type and scale factors used to estimate larval population.  Use each element in the array to specify a habitat type and max larval capacity. LINEAR_SPLINE has a more detailed scaling configuration.  See the documentation for more information.

Immature_Duration.description: The number of days for larvae to develop into adult mosquitoes. The value is used to calculate mosquito development rate, which equals 1 / (value of this parameter). Note that development from immature individual to adult is not dependent on temperature.

Indoor_Feeding_Fraction.description: The fraction (dimensionless) of feeds in which mosquitoes feed on humans indoors; the fraction of feeds on humans that occur outdoors equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Infected_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for sporogony as vectors progress from infected status to infectious.

Infected_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for sporogony as vectors progress from infected status to infectious.

Infected_Egg_Batch_Factor.description: The dimensionless factor used to modify mosquito egg batch size  in order to account for reduced fertility effects arising due to infection (e.g. when females undergo sporogony).

Infectious_Human_Feed_Mortality_Factor.description: The (dimensionless) factor used to modify the death rate of mosquitoes when feeding on humans, to account for the higher mortality rate infected mosquitoes experience during human feeds versus uninfected mosquitoes.

Male_Life_Expectancy.description: Number of days an average male mosquito survives. The daily male mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Microsporidia.description: A list of microsporidia parameters for each strain that this species can get.

Name.description: Name of this species of vectors

Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle.description: Effect of temperature on the duration between blood feeds.

Transmission_Rate.description: Probability that the bite of an infected mosquito establishes a new infection in an immunologically naive and uninfected individual, or the modifier of the probability of success for an individual with pre-erythrocytic immunity.

Vector_Migration_Filename.description: Path to the vector migration file defining patterns of vector migration to other nodes.

Vector_Migration_Food_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node currently occupied by humans, independent of the number of humans in the node. This only applies to female migrating vectors.

Vector_Migration_Habitat_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node with more habitat. This applies only to female migrating vectors.

Vector_Migration_Modifier_Equation.description: Functional form of vector migration modifiers. This applies only to female migrating vectors.

Vector_Migration_Stay_Put_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to remain in its current node rather than migrate to another node. This applies only to female migrating vectors.

Vector_Sugar_Feeding_Frequency.description: The frequency of sugar feeding by a female mosquito. Used in used in conjunction with the SugarTrap and OvipositionTrap interventions.

x_Vector_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of vector migration to other nodes.

Box_Duration.description: The box duration of the effect in days.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Box_Duration.description: The box duration of the effect in days.

Decay_Time_Constant.description: The exponential decay length, in days.  The current effect is initialized with **Initial_Effect** and it is updated each time step as 'current_effect *= (1 - dt/**Decay_Time_Constant**)' (dt equal to delta time).

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Add_Effects.description: The **Add_Effects** parameter allows you to combine multiple effects from the waning effect classes. If set to true (1), then the waning effect values from the different waning effect objects are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value must be greater than 1.

Effect_List.description: A list of nested JSON parameters to indicate how the intervention efficacy wanes over time.

Expires_When_All_Expire.description: If set to true (1), then all of the effects, as specified in the **Effect_List** parameter, must expire for the efficacy of the intervention to expire. If set to false (0), then the efficacy of the intervention will expire as soon as one of the parameters expires.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Decay_Time_Constant.description: The exponential decay length, in days.  The current effect is initialized with **Initial_Effect** and it is updated each time step as 'current_effect *= (1 - dt/**Decay_Time_Constant**)' (dt equal to delta time).

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Expire_At_Durability_Map_End.description: Set to 1 to let the intervention expire when the end of the map is reached.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Reference_Timer.description: The timestamp at which linear-map should be anchored.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Expire_At_Durability_Map_End.description: Set to 1 to let the intervention expire when the end of the map is reached.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Reference_Timer.description: The timestamp at which linear-map should be anchored.

Expected_Discard_Time.description: The mean time, in days, of an exponential distribution of the duration of the effect of an intervention (such as a vaccine or bed net). Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Use_Defaults.description: Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for event coordinators and interventions. Use at own risk.
Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for the reports.
